00142 int nfs3_Access( nfs_arg_t               * parg,    
00143                  exportlist_t            * pexport, 
00144                  fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext,   
00145                  cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00146                  hash_table_t            * ht,
00147                  struct svc_req          * preq,    
00148                  nfs_res_t               * pres )   
00149 {
00150         static char               funcName[] = "nfs3_Access";
00151 
00152   fsal_accessflags_t        access_mode ;
00153   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00154   cache_inode_file_type_t   filetype ;
00155   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
00156   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsal_data  ;
00157   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
00158   
00159    /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00160    pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resfail.obj_attributes.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00161 
00162    /* Convert file handle into a fsal_handle */
00163    if( nfs3_FhandleToFSAL( &(parg->arg_access3.object), &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) == 0  )
00164         return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00165 
00166   /* Get cache_inode related entry, but looking up at it */
00167   fsal_data.cookie = DIR_START ;
00168 
00169   /* Get the entry in the cache_inode */
00170   if( ( pentry = cache_inode_get( &fsal_data, 
00171                                   &attr, 
00172                                   ht, 
00173                                   pclient, 
00174                                   pcontext, 
00175                                   &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00176     {
00177       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00178       pres->res_access3.status = NFS3ERR_STALE ;
00179       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00180     }
00181   
00182   /* Get file type */
00183   filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
00184   
00185 
00186         access_mode = 0;
00187   
00188         if( parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_READ )
00189     access_mode |= FSAL_R_OK ;
00190   
00191         if( parg->arg_access3.access &
00192             (ACCESS3_MODIFY | ACCESS3_EXTEND) )
00193     access_mode |= FSAL_W_OK ;
00194   
00195         if( filetype == REGULAR_FILE )
00196     {
00197       if (parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_EXECUTE)
00198         access_mode |= FSAL_X_OK;
00199     }
00200   else if( parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_LOOKUP )
00201     access_mode |= X_OK;
00202 
00203   
00204   /* Perform the 'access' call */
00205         if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00206                           access_mode, 
00207                           ht, 
00208                           pclient, 
00209                           pcontext, 
00210                           &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00211     {
00212       /* In Unix, delete permission only applies to directories */
00213       
00214       if ( filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00215         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = parg->arg_access3.access;
00216       else
00217         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = (parg->arg_access3.access & ~ACCESS3_DELETE);
00218       
00219       /* Build Post Op Attributes */
00220       nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext,
00221                          pexport,
00222                          pentry,
00223                          &attr,
00224                          &(pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.obj_attributes));
00225       
00226       pres->res_access3.status = NFS3_OK;
00227       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00228     }
00229         
00230   if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EACCESS )
00231     {
00232       /*
00233        * We have to determine which access bits are good one by one 
00234        */
00235       pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = 0;
00236       
00237       if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00238                               FSAL_R_OK,
00239                               ht, 
00240                               pclient, 
00241                               pcontext, 
00242                               &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00243         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_READ;
00244       
00245       if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00246                               FSAL_W_OK,
00247                               ht, 
00248                               pclient, 
00249                               pcontext, 
00250                               &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00251         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= (ACCESS3_MODIFY | ACCESS3_EXTEND) ;
00252       
00253       if( filetype == REGULAR_FILE )
00254         {
00255           if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00256                                   FSAL_X_OK,
00257                                   ht, 
00258                                   pclient, 
00259                                   pcontext, 
00260                                   &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00261             pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_EXECUTE;
00262         } 
00263       else
00264         {
00265           if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00266                                   FSAL_X_OK,
00267                                   ht, 
00268                                   pclient, 
00269                                   pcontext, 
00270                                   &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00271             pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_LOOKUP;
00272         }
00273       
00274       pres->res_read3.status = NFS3_OK;
00275       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00276     }
00277   
00278         /* If we are here, there was an error */
00279         if( nfs_RetryableError(cache_status) )
00280     {
00281       return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00282     }
00283   
00284         nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00285                        NFS_V3,
00286                        cache_status,
00287                        NULL,
00288                        &pres->res_access3.status,
00289                        pentry,
00290                        &(pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resfail.obj_attributes),
00291                        NULL, NULL, NULL,
00292                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00293         return NFS_REQ_OK;
00294 
00295 } /* nfs3_Access */
00296 
00305 void nfs3_Access_Free( nfs_res_t * pres )
00306 {
00307   /* Nothing to do */
00308   return ;
00309 } /* nfs3_Access_Free */
